Meliora (Latin for the pursuit of something better) is the third full-length album by Swedish heavy metal band Ghost. 
The album was released August 21, 2015. 
On this album the lead vocalist retires his Papa Emeritus II stage name and now goes by Papa Emeritus III.

Ghost began crafting their third studio album, the follow up to 2013's Infestissumam, at the end of 2014.

On May 29, Meliora's artwork and tracklist went public.

The song "Cirice" was released as a free download from the band's official site on May 31. A music video June 8. Directed by Roboshobo, it is an elementary school version of the 1976 horror film Carrie.

The song "Absolution" was released on Spotify on July 31. It was released in Scandinavia only.

Thomas Woroniak of Antihero Magazine said "Ghost come out on top offering a compelling addition to the overarching message of self-determined freedom with a well-crafted album that rocks harder than ever." He also added that the album "delivers more of a modern edge with sharper teeth when compared to its predecessor, while maintaining continuity with the overall evolution of the bandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s characteristic sound.
